headline: New Treasury license allows U.S. oil companies to expand in Venezuela
summary: Investing.com -- The Trump administration issued a general license expanding the ability of oil companies to operate in Venezuela on Thursday. This move marks a significant step to ease sanctions under the new US-backed leadership in Caracas following the ousting of Nicolás Maduro. The Treasury Department’s license covers a variety of activities necessary to export, sell, store and market Venezuelan crude. It specifically includes the "arrangement of shipping and logistics services" to facilitat

headline: Oil Rallies On Iran War Fears – 5 Integrated Energy Giants With Big Dividends
summary: With an armada of U.S. Navy ships steaming toward the Mediterranean, military action against Iran would pose significant risks to global oil markets due to Iran’s control over the Strait of Hormuz, through which roughly 20-30% of the world’s seaborne oil passes. headline: Three Top Dividend Stocks To Consider For Your Portfolio
summary: As the U.S. stock market navigates a period of steady interest rates and anticipates major tech earnings, investors are closely watching for opportunities that offer stability and income. In such an environment, dividend stocks can be appealing, providing a potential source of regular income while also offering the possibility of capital appreciation amidst fluctuating market conditions.
